did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Howell for Governor Campaign financial records, 1972-1973

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Howell for Governor Campaign financial records, 1972-1973. Accession 28024. Organization records collection. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Henry E. Howell, Jr., Norfolk and Richmond, Virginia.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Accessions 28083, 28129, and 28180 are filed with accession 28024.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Henry E. Howell (1920-1997) was the Democratic nominee for governor of Virginia in 1973. He lost an extremely close race to Republican Mills Godwin (1914-1999).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Financial records, 1972-1973, of the Howell for Governor Campaign consisting of disclosures of all contributions to and disbursements by the campaign for Henry E. Howell (1920-1997), Democratic candidate for governor of Virginia. Reports are from both the statewide campaign and local organizations supporting Howell. Papers also include Howell's personal financial records consisting of income tax returns, life insurance policies, and stock certificates.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: Series I: Disclosure of all Contributions and Disbursements, 1972-1973

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Howell for Governor, 1977 campaign financial disclosures, 1975-1977 (LVA accession 29469)
Mills E. Godwin for Governor Campaign reports of campaign contributions and expenditures, 1973-1974 (LVA accession 28165).
